intro: Psychotria cuneata, commonly known as the "whitemarked psychotria," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves with prominent veins. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Psychotria cuneata is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
